{{cpp/chrono/system_clock/title|from_time_t}}
{{cpp/chrono/system_clock/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
static std::chrono::system_clock::time_point from_time_t( std::time_t t ) noexcept;
}}

Converts {{c|t}} to a time point type, using the coarser precision of the two types.

If {{tt|time_point}} has lower precision, it is implementation defined whether the value is rounded or truncated.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|t|{{lc|std::time_t}} value to convert}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
A value of type [[cpp/chrono/system_clock#Member types|{{tt|std::chrono::system_clock::time_point}}]] representing {{c|t}}.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;ctime&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;thread&gt;

int main()
{
    using namespace std::chrono_literals;

    const std::time_t t = std::time(nullptr); // usually has "1 second" precision

    const auto from = std::chrono::system_clock::from_time_t(t);

    std::this_thread::sleep_for(500ms);

    const auto diff = std::chrono::system_clock::now() - from;

    std::cout &lt;&lt; diff &lt;&lt; " ("
              &lt;&lt; std::chrono::round&lt;std::chrono::milliseconds&gt;(diff)
              &lt;&lt; ")\n";
}
|p=true
|output=987654321ns (987ms)
}}
